attributes.action: delay Ministers plans to give local Councils £29.5m to 'police' the Smoking Ban in England... At least give citizens and companies a chance to comply with the news rules, before adopting such a costly, 'heavy-handed and elaborate' approach.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: Ministers have given councils £29.5m to train council staff to 'police' the Smoking Ban in England. They will have the power to enter premises undercover, allowing them to sit among citizens, and will be able to photograph and film people. Whilst ensuring compliance may become necessary in time, are such 'pre-emptive' and hugely expensive measures really necessary, without even offering the country a chance to respect and adapt to the new laws?
